alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Ashe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 4:55PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Alleghany and northeastern Ashe Counties in northwestern North Carolina through 530 PM EDT... At 454 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wagoner to near Barrett. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Localized flooding in poor drainage and low-lying areas. Locations impacted include... Sparta... Jefferson... West Jefferson... Lansing... Stratford... Scottville... and Piney Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
